body_html:
@fbolanos, Vijay was correct. The example uses DirectSession that didn't share the underlying GPUDevice. They are not good for parallel execution. Other types of sessions do not have this problem. There are other effort trying to unite the session implementations that will address this problem at the same time.

Please try "--num_concurrent_sessions=1" and "--num_concurrent_steps=1" for your experiments. If you don't see any exceptions with those, then everything is good.

body:
@fbolanos, Vijay was correct. The example uses DirectSession that didn't share the underlying GPUDevice. They are not good for parallel execution. Other types of sessions do not have this problem. There are other effort trying to unite the session implementations that will address this problem at the same time. 

Please try "--num_concurrent_sessions=1" and "--num_concurrent_steps=1" for your experiments. If you don't see any exceptions with those, then everything is good.
